ai.summary: Knockie Viewpoint is a 6 km moderate hike in the UK, offering a rewarding viewpoint after a varied trail with gentle ascents and occasional rocky sections.
ai.terrain_summary: The route traverses grassy paths, short rocky climbs, and potential muddy sections. Expect uneven footing near the viewpoint and some exposed sections with modest elevation gain.
ai.safety_notes: Check the local forecast before setting out. Stay on marked paths, especially in boggy or rocky areas. Wear sturdy boots, bring layers for changeable UK weather, and carry a map or GPS. Let someone know your plans and pace yourself to avoid fatigue.
recommended_gear: Headtorch or flashlight (in case of late return)
ai.best_seasons: Spring to autumn when daylight hours are longer and the weather is more stable. Avoid heavy rain periods if possible.
